item.title: Anonymous: Comment 5
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
I managed to get Tor 0.2.2.16-alpha to build on Windows.

Im using:
OpenSSL (openssl-0.9.8o)
Zlib (libevent-1.4.14b-stable)

I had to revert changes in eventdns.c to that of 0.2.2.15-alpha.

Also when building the OpenSSL library I had to use this config statement:
./config -no-idea -no-rc5 -no-mdc2 -no-hw

The -no-hw switch turns off the hardware support, since -no-engines does not currently work in this version.

Also, with Vidalia 0.2.10, in the Network Map there does appear to be as many 'red dots' representing servers in the global map.

Other than this its been running fine here, and on a beta testers machine, for several days.

I hope this helps...

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 7

item.description:
I am trying to create a Youtube account. It doesn't let me, saying that:

"Sorry for the interruption. We have been receiving a large volume of requests from your network. To continue with your YouTube experience, please enter the verification code below."

It then prompts me infinite number of times to enter Captcha code. I enter everything correctly but keeps asking for more and more Captcha codes.

WTF???

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 8
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
You may need to make sure you have cookies enabled and javascript is allowed to run.

I actually relax the security options in the Tor button just enough to allow me to watch youtube videos.

item.title: Anonymous: Comment 9
item.dcterms:creator: Anonymous
item.description:
Dear Tor developers,

I couldn't use the latest 0.2.1.26 on my old Windows 2000 PC. It said similar messages: "some system calls can't be found on KERNEL.DLL.". Fortunately, I have a copy of vidalia-bundle-0.2.0.34-0.1.10 downloaded from your website. The 0.2.0.34 works on Windows 2000 and this is why I can read your dear site. Thanks

item.title: phobos: Comment 10
item.dcterms:creator: phobos
item.description: I think you're confusing the two issues. Tor itself works fine in Win200. Vidalia, the graphical controller, does not. See https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/TheOnionRouter/TorFAQ#Vida... for details.
